intro: Hydrocharis morsus-ranae var. asiatica, commonly known as the frog-bit, is a floating aquatic plant native to Asia. It has small, heart-shaped leaves that are typically less than 2 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and it is often found in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats. It is a member of the Araceae family and is known for its ability to form dense mats on the water surface. This variant is adapted to the specific environmental conditions of its native range in Asia.
